Examples Package¶

On this page you find some example packages, which all reside in the examples directory. Please checkout the [source] links on the right for the individual modules.

Basic setup and running¶

Example use of the CmsAnalysisAC3B toolkit.

class cmstoolsac3b_example.configexample.CrtlFiltStackPlotter(tool_name=None)[source]¶

An cmstoolsac3b_example stack plotter with data overlay.

run()[source]¶

Load, stack, print and save histograms in a stream.

Sample Definition¶

An example Sample definition.

class cmstoolsac3b_example.sampledefinition.FirstMCSample[source]¶

Shortest possible Declaration

input_files = ['/the/path/to/all/input/files/some/dir/qcd*.root']¶

specify input files. Globbing is use, so ‘*’ is fine.

lumi = 50000.0¶

Luminosity: Unit has to be consistent over all samples.

class cmstoolsac3b_example.sampledefinition.TheDataSample[source]¶

Data sample: notice ‘is_data’!

is_data = True¶

set this to ‘True’ for data samples.

class cmstoolsac3b_example.sampledefinition.OtherMCSample[source]¶

Extensive Declaration

enable = True¶

Force usage. Also see settings.default_enable_sample

n_events = 1000000¶

either ‘n_events’ and ‘x_sec’ or ‘lumi’ has to be provided.

x_sec = 165.0¶

cross section

output_file = '/a/folder/for/all/eventoutput/'¶

if not ends on ‘.root’ ‘samplename.root’ is appended

legend = 't#bart Inclusive'¶

legend string: Many samples can have the same.

cmsRun_args = 'this is passed to cmsRun execution'¶

can be string or list of strings

Settings for processing¶

Settings example for processing.

These are the default settings of the utilities.settings module, so this file is really only for demonstrative purposes.

cmstoolsac3b_example.settingsprofile_proc.dummy_func()[source]¶

This is just a dummy to include this source file.

Settings for post-processing¶

Settings example for post processing. Taken from an existing analysis.

cmstoolsac3b_example.settingsprofile_postproc.dummy_func()[source]¶

This is just a dummy to include this source file.

Predefined post-processing tools¶

Post processing tools that can be used nearly out-of-the-box.

class cmstoolsac3b_example.postproctools.StackPlusDataPlotter(tool_name=None)[source]¶

Subclass me and feed the data members!

store_stack_and_data_in_pool = False¶

Set True to drop all stacks and histos into the pool.

canvas_decorators = []¶

Give Decorators for the canvas builder.

canvas_callback = None¶

Callback function, called with CanvasBuilders before execution.

histo_filter_dict = {}¶

Filter dict. see histotools.generators.filter for specification.

wanna_reuse(all_reused_before_me)[source]¶

In this method one can check, if data from last time running is still available. If yes is returned, then run() is not called.

store_to_pool(stream_stack_n_data)[source]¶

Keep stacks and data histograms in histopool, for later use. The stream has to be splitted in a stack and a data stream and to be rejoined in the end.

run()[source]¶

Load, stack, print and save histograms in a stream.
